Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/creating-account
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=p3dtsoc3fnf3cm7ush16taso64; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=p3dtsoc3fnf3cm7ush16taso64; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=qFyt/6A/R6CYXuyEuU8sAArx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAChRpJY4wYBBr6VObOGIVx6; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=qFyt/6A/R6CYXuyEuU8sAArx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAChRpJY4wYBBr6VObOGIVx6; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=c3RIcvSwkhyNIb9nPoq4AQrx1VYAAAAA3Dno6QFf5sFAM2aKXhx6wg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=c3RIcvSwkhyNIb9nPoq4AQrx1VYAAAAA3Dno6QFf5sFAM2aKXhx6wg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=p3dtsoc3fnf3cm7ush16taso64; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=p3dtsoc3fnf3cm7ush16taso64; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=qFyt/6A/R6CYXuyEuU8sAArx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAChRpJY4wYBBr6VObOGIVx6; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=qFyt/6A/R6CYXuyEuU8sAArx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAChRpJY4wYBBr6VObOGIVx6; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Description

URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=c3RIcvSwkhyNIb9nPoq4AQrx1VYAAAAA3Dno6QFf5sFAM2aKXhx6wg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=c3RIcvSwkhyNIb9nPoq4AQrx1VYAAAAA3Dno6QFf5sFAM2aKXhx6wg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-a-listing
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/find-a-roommate
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Parameter
PHPSESSID=jrdcfgaqalck20aoarmv5fink0; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=jrdcfgaqalck20aoarmv5fink0; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

URL

Parameter

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Parameter
PHPSESSID=jrdcfgaqalck20aoarmv5fink0; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=jrdcfgaqalck20aoarmv5fink0; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=1FzSijRWQuacvUa9aMDuxgrx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAD9vB8v54ukULLo8+j5sqYk; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:23:46 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=1FzSijRWQuacvUa9aMDuxgrx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAD9vB8v54ukULLo8+j5sqYk; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:23:46 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/individual-private-owner-1
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/category/property-management-company-1
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/who-can-register-on-this-site
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Parameter
PHPSESSID=56h3ntj410loeem4vu7fj9pmv1; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=56h3ntj410loeem4vu7fj9pmv1; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.

Evidence

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.

https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=iS4SaAhC5Vk6J79nPoq4AQvx1VYAAAAAJAYhcYsP9USAXq2SOAycDA==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=iS4SaAhC5Vk6J79nPoq4AQvx1VYAAAAAJAYhcYsP9USAXq2SOAycDA==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Parameter
PHPSESSID=56h3ntj410loeem4vu7fj9pmv1; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=56h3ntj410loeem4vu7fj9pmv1; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/can-i-post-a-sublet-on-the-message-boards
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
PHPSESSID=i2s3e6b31hln8decnesqep0fu2; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=i2s3e6b31hln8decnesqep0fu2; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=BQYeDXLcSXWfjerkV5lLtA7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAACI70exIbCfgy8wc3MWo9Fu; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:07 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=BQYeDXLcSXWfjerkV5lLtA7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAACI70exIbCfgy8wc3MWo9Fu; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:07 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=oJ1wdr46PVQBM79nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAA09hPFxS2wCfp/+mX/Wfthg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=oJ1wdr46PVQBM79nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAA09hPFxS2wCfp/+mX/Wfthg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
PHPSESSID=i2s3e6b31hln8decnesqep0fu2; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=i2s3e6b31hln8decnesqep0fu2; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=BQYeDXLcSXWfjerkV5lLtA7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAACI70exIbCfgy8wc3MWo9Fu; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:07 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=BQYeDXLcSXWfjerkV5lLtA7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAACI70exIbCfgy8wc3MWo9Fu; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:07 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=oJ1wdr46PVQBM79nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAA09hPFxS2wCfp/+mX/Wfthg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=oJ1wdr46PVQBM79nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAA09hPFxS2wCfp/+mX/Wfthg==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-account
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-a-listing
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Solution

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/create-a-listing
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=3pr8s2of1l1lmb142k0t62t526; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=3pr8s2of1l1lmb142k0t62t526; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=1Tmeg0vPQzab4tDy+JrC5w7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAADDQeyWuZg/WIDzIbflATD+; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=1Tmeg0vPQzab4tDy+JrC5w7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAADDQeyWuZg/WIDzIbflATD+; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=PCE/JOKSTCmnNb9nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAAu8jpMHI13DiN8Sbb6WCKeA==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=PCE/JOKSTCmnNb9nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAAu8jpMHI13DiN8Sbb6WCKeA==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=3pr8s2of1l1lmb142k0t62t526; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=3pr8s2of1l1lmb142k0t62t526; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=1Tmeg0vPQzab4tDy+JrC5w7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAADDQeyWuZg/WIDzIbflATD+; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=1Tmeg0vPQzab4tDy+JrC5w7x1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAADDQeyWuZg/WIDzIbflATD+; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=PCE/JOKSTCmnNb9nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAAu8jpMHI13DiN8Sbb6WCKeA==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=PCE/JOKSTCmnNb9nPoq4AQ7x1VYAAAAAu8jpMHI13DiN8Sbb6WCKeA==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/turning-off-listing
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-multiple-listings
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-multiple-listings
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/add-multiple-listings
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/user/inbox
Parameter
PHPSESSID=76itrbc0p98mu82q8ijejabpa2; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=76itrbc0p98mu82q8ijejabpa2; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/user/inbox
Parameter
PHPSESSID=76itrbc0p98mu82q8ijejabpa2; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=76itrbc0p98mu82q8ijejabpa2; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/adding-another-email-address-to-your-account
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/adding-another-email-address-to-your-account
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/adding-another-email-address-to-your-account
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/adding-another-email-address-to-your-account
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/adding-another-email-address-to-your-account
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

visid_incap_496857=Mf+Zj/0bS/moXs9smC0D5RDx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAABoGs30kBSdrt2x8ZjoaOkL; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=Mf+Zj/0bS/moXs9smC0D5RDx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAABoGs30kBSdrt2x8ZjoaOkL; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:24:01 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/roommate-edit/delete
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=Cf2GV1dGznOaPL9nPoq4ARDx1VYAAAAAc/lc1zga0G5S5tY9Q5g0bw==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=Cf2GV1dGznOaPL9nPoq4ARDx1VYAAAAAc/lc1zga0G5S5tY9Q5g0bw==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/roommate-edit/delete
Parameter
PHPSESSID=6f6optiacpuna39h32p9gjddg3; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=6f6optiacpuna39h32p9gjddg3; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=/zEycjqAtWTNQL9nPoq4ARHx1VYAAAAA0Z4t9HSCI42Yejb/jrEdRw==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=/zEycjqAtWTNQL9nPoq4ARHx1VYAAAAA0Z4t9HSCI42Yejb/jrEdRw==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Parameter
PHPSESSID=di0futfhhc2j5oe5kktcsjcrl5; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=di0futfhhc2j5oe5kktcsjcrl5; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=cHoGEzfqTWe7fvhhU8rBIBHx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAC7tM62iGWaKtRPRULBY/9M; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:23:48 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=cHoGEzfqTWe7fvhhU8rBIBHx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAC7tM62iGWaKtRPRULBY/9M; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:23:48 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Parameter
incap_ses_124_496857=/zEycjqAtWTNQL9nPoq4ARHx1VYAAAAA0Z4t9HSCI42Yejb/jrEdRw==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
incap_ses_124_496857=/zEycjqAtWTNQL9nPoq4ARHx1VYAAAAA0Z4t9HSCI42Yejb/jrEdRw==; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-list-my-rental
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-search-for-a-rental-listing
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Evidence

Solution

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

CWE Id

525

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=f0qklsfp0745l505pr9b5hr2c0; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=f0qklsfp0745l505pr9b5hr2c0; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

Evidence

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=f0qklsfp0745l505pr9b5hr2c0; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=f0qklsfp0745l505pr9b5hr2c0; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Parameter
visid_incap_496857=kMEJYEx4RsCyDqUQw/fQABPx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAB+x296nMq+BqEw0FfyD3lJ; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:23:48 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu
Evidence
visid_incap_496857=kMEJYEx4RsCyDqUQw/fQABPx1VYAAAAAQUIPAAAAAAB+x296nMq+BqEw0FfyD3lJ; expires=Wed, 01 Mar 2017 12:23:48 GMT; path=/; Domain=.berkeley.edu

URL

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-edit-my-listing
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

Description

The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-create-my-rental-listing
Evidence
no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0

Solution

Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Session_Management_Cheat_Sheet#Web_Content_Caching

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cookie set without secure flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the secure flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed via unencrypted connections.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-renew-my-listing
Parameter
PHPSESSID=6a95nl9oshinbj45glf05mmd41; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=6a95nl9oshinbj45glf05mmd41; path=/

Solution

Whenever a cookie contains sensitive information or is a session token, then it should always be passed using an encrypted tunnel. Ensure that the secure flag is set for cookies containing such sensitive information.

Reference

http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Testing_for_cookies_attributes_(OWASP-SM-002)

WASC Id

13

Evidence

WASC Id

13

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-renew-my-listing
Parameter
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js
Evidence
//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Cross-Domain JavaScript Source File Inclusion

Description

The page at the following URL includes one or more script files from a third-party domain
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-renew-my-listing
Parameter
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit
Evidence
//translate.google.com/translate_a/element.js?cb=googleTranslateElementInit

Solution

Ensure JavaScript source files are loaded from only trusted sources, and the sources can't be controlled by end users of the application

Reference

Low (Medium)Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled

Description

Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled, or is disabled by the configuration of the 'X-XSS-Protection' HTTP response header on the web server
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-renew-my-listing
Other information
The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header allows the web server to enable or disable the web browser's XSS protection mechanism. The following values would attempt to enable it: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=http://www.example.com/xss The following values would disable it: X-XSS-Protection: 0 The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is currently supported on Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari (WebKit). Note that this alert is only raised if the response body could potentially contain an XSS payload (with a text-based content type, with a non-zero length).

Solution

Ensure that the web browser's XSS filter is enabled, by setting the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1'.

Reference

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_(Cross_Site_Scripting)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet

https://blog.veracode.com/2014/03/guidelines-for-setting-security-headers/

CWE Id

933

WASC Id

14

Low (Medium)X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

Description

The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/help/article/how-do-i-renew-my-listing
Other information
This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

Solution

Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.

Reference

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/gg622941%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/List_of_useful_HTTP_headers

WASC Id

15

Low (Medium)Cookie set without HttpOnly flag

Description

A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. If a malicious script can be run on this page then the cookie will be accessible and can be transmitted to another site. If this is a session cookie then session hijacking may be possible.
URL
https://och.berkeley.edu/user
Parameter
PHPSESSID=nslfuvd57vfkigm5idi2ts54f4; path=/
Evidence
PHPSESSID=nslfuvd57vfkigm5idi2ts54f4; path=/

Solution

Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.

Reference

www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly
